summary: This is an internal staffing report for the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York, dated August 12, 2019. It details staffing levels, recruitment efforts, and daily absence data for Correctional Services staff for the period August 3-10, 2019. The document provides operational context for the facility where Jeffrey Epstein was held.

events.title: MCC New York Career Fair
events.description: A career fair was held at 290 Broadway with 174 potential applicants in attendance as part of recruitment efforts.

events.title: Scheduled Officer Start Date
events.description: Two additional Correctional Officers are scheduled to start work.

keyFacts: As of August 12, 2019, MCC New York had an overall staffing level of 84.86% and a Correctional Services staffing level of 83.70%.
There were 19 vacant officer positions, with 4 officers in new employee training and 2 more scheduled to start on September 15, 2019.
The facility had been approved for a 10% relocation incentive and a 10% recruitment incentive since April 12, 2019.

A detailed daily absence report for Correctional Services staff from August 3-10, 2019, shows significant use of sick leave, leave without pay (LWOP), and absent without leave (AWOL) statuses, accounting for 177 unfilled posts over the 8-day period.
The report indicates ongoing staffing challenges at the federal detention facility in the months leading up to and following Jeffrey Epstein's death in custody.
